RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui doutorado em Dottorato in Fisica - Università degli Studi di Modena e Reggio Emilia (2005). Tem experiência na área de Física, com ênfase em Estruturas Eletrônicas e Propriedades Elétricas de Superfícies; Interf. e Partículas; Propriedade magnetica na interfacça
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: doctorate at Dottorato in Fisica from Università degli Studi di Modena e Reggio Emilia (2005). Has experience in Physics, focusing on Electronic Structure and Electrical Properties of Surfaces; Interf. and Particles

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Engineering organic molecular films for spintronics applications
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The project aimed at the insitu
preparation of multilayered structure consisting of two ferromagnetic films sandwiching
an organic film that mimics a hybrid spin valve. One of the ferromagnetic thin film is
LSMO that has stable surface to oxidization and excellent magnetic polarization at room
temperature. The growth of high quality LSMO samples through PLD is optimized in terms
of magnetic properties and surface roughness. Prerequisite for the in-situ sample preparation
is the possibility to grow the molecular film in a UHV chamber connected with experimental
chamber. Part of project was dedicated to the design of UHV chamber and UHV compatible
manipulator that it should be dedicated to molecular deposition. The characterization of the
magnetic properties of each layer will be done by element selective x-ray magnetic circular
dichroism.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
The project aimed at the insitu
preparation of multilayered structure consisting of two ferromagnetic films sandwiching
an organic film that mimics a hybrid spin valve. One of the ferromagnetic thin film is
LSMO that has stable surface to oxidization and excellent magnetic polarization at room
temperature. The growth of high quality LSMO samples through PLD is optimized in terms
of magnetic properties and surface roughness. Prerequisite for the in-situ sample preparation
is the possibility to grow the molecular film in a UHV chamber connected with experimental
chamber. Part of project was dedicated to the design of UHV chamber and UHV compatible
manipulator that it should be dedicated to molecular deposition. The characterization of the
magnetic properties of each layer will be done by element selective x-ray magnetic circular
dichroism.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Engineering organic molecular films for spintronics applications
